If you are one of the exempted from the travel ban (Filipino citizen, foreign permanent resident, foreign spouse, foreign child, or a diplomat), then you don't have to change it as long as your flight won't be canceled and if you are allowed to transit via Abu Dhabi (Look for Abu Dhabi travel restrictions).If you are a foreigner with a non-essential visit, then we do not know if the travel ban will be lifted on your travel date.As per the immigration website, travel ban is implemented until further notice. Unless we have a crystal ball, we cannot definitely tell when exactly the travel ban will be lifted.You can take the risk. Assess the probability. Then make your decision.For me it is better. Which date should you change it? I don't know. For others opinion or advice, I don't know. For you, I don't know.We can give opinion as of the moment but we cannot back it up with facts since the implementation of the policy has an uncertain effectivity.Manila will end it's Enhanced Community Quarantine in May 15. After May 15, it will be turned into a General Community Quarantine which is a more relaxed lockdown, but according to the news, GCQ will allow a reduced capacity commercial flights for essential travels and those that are not covered by the travel ban, however we still don't know how long will this be implemented. Just like ECQ that was extended 2 times, it could happen with GCQ too.So to be able to enter the Philippines in June 3, it's better if you are one of the exempted and your travel is essential.If not, you can try but take note that the travel ban is implemented until further notice as stated above and if you ask my opinion, I think it won't be lifted even in June, especially if you consider the current situation of the UK as one of the factors to continuously impose the travel ban.
